p: Polymers or macromolecules are derivatives of petroleum or natural gas characterized by long chain molecules, classified as elastomers (rubbers), plastics and fibers. They are the second-most important basic materials and are expected to exceed a global production of 420 million tonnes annually in 2020 [ 1]. The industrial, environmental and economic advantages of polymeric materials outscore the conventional materials throughout their life cycle, despite the end of life (EOL) considerations [ 1]. The fossil hydrocarbons used in the production of plastics are returned to the fuel cycle at the EOL ( Figure 1) [ 2].
